name: Insanity Clicker
description: Been looking for the thrill? Then you've come to the right place! Insanity Clicker is a time-killer game full of horror and fear that will make you tremble in a couple of minutes!
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows Server 2008, Windows XP, Windows 7, or Windows 8 Classic Processor: 2.33GHz or faster x86-compatible processor, or Intel Atom™ 1.6GHz or faster processor for netbook class devices Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Intel HD graphics 4000 or above Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: Integrated sound card
recommended_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows Server 2008, Windows XP, Windows 7, or Windows 8 Classic Processor: Intel i3 or faster processor for netbook class devices or above Memory: 1024 MB RAM Graphics: Intel HD graphics 4000 or above Storage: 500 MB available space Sound Card: Integrated sound card

reviews.review_text: I see it's like a ripoff of Clicker heroes, but there are some things that i think are cool -Dark atmosphere, not fully terror, but can scare a few people and i like it -The timer for the boss is a little bar that follows his health, i find this interesting -You can customise your character, by the time i write this i still haven't got a sinlge equipment, but i find this a good idea too -The art is truly amazing, congrats specially for the monsters designs  Overall i give this a solid 6/10, might be a good game somewhere in the future with a few updates here and there

Note: As this is a Free to Play title, this review should be taken with a grain or two of salt. I've only played up to level 9. Note 2: I've also played very little of this game, so don't take this review to heart too seriously. Insanity Clicker is essentially a Reskinned Clicker Heroes.  You click on the monster to kill it, and you only progress to the next level when ten enemies are killed on the most recent level, or you've killed the boss on levels of multiples of 5. As far as I know, progression is impossible whilst offline, as is a usual weakness with this mechanic.  As you kill monsters, you gain currency. In others, it's usualy Gold, here it's Teeth. Functions identically however, as you purchase pets, which are your main source of increasing your Damage until Ascensions, at which point you'll gain a special second currency, likely named Spirits. These are most likely used to purchase upgrades that are effective across each run, inbetween ascensions.  As you upgrade your pets, you can unlock spells. As far as I have seen, there's the typical arrangement of spells. Click Damage boosts, Drop Increases, Gold per click boosts, spell power increase, spell cooldown decrease, essentially every skill in Clicker Heroes is here.  There's an auto-progress mode, a very negligible array of options to only turn on/off music, sounds, or any other audio in the game, turn on scientific notation numbers, and other graphical on/off modes. There's also a button for Fullscreen.  I'm personally/currently unsure of what Illnesses are, but I imagine they're not too different from Clicker Heroes' Ancients, essentially requiring Ascension Currency to purchase/upgrade upgradeable objects which give scalable, and powerful boosts, some of which may be infinitely upgradeable or not.  There is also an Idle mode, but as far as I know, it only serves to collect teeth for you.  As far as the above, mostly all of them are basically in Clicker Heroes, the only one that isn't, is the Idle Mode, due to the effect always being on.  The graphics look rather nice however, being highly detailed, with each character looking nice and creepy if not horrifying, with each art asset looking like it fits in with one another very nicely. Haven't listened to the music, but I imagine it's fairly decent.  You do have the option of dressing your character, choosing between male or female, and being able to dress them with weapons, shirts, pants, underwear, shoes, socks, pets etc. Only... as far as I know, there's absolutely nothing to do that with yet.  Altogether though, I can't really recommend the game. It's too mechanically similar to Clicker Heroes to really justify it's own existence on the same platform as it.  That being said... if you want a game that's almost mechanically identical to Clicker Heroes, this will be in your area. It's personally not a game I can enjoy too much.

I was really excited when this came up on my discovery queue, and despite seeing a mixed review status, I downloaded the game. I like that there is a more horror theme version of clicker heroes and I do not mind the microtransactions, but the big flaw of this game is that it cannot be played completely offline. I have limited internet data per month plan that has to be shared with four other people, and I am forced to play most of my steam games offline because of how expensive data overages are. I will continue to play this game online, when I can, but if the devs are as active with the steam community as some of the other comments suggest, they should really allow for offline play. I would recommend it as it fun to play.

This game is fun, and you can pass the time playing this game without even noticing, an awesome idle game, really nice concept this horror theme on the other hand a thing that bugs me is the currency collection (the teeth) its a bit annoying when you dont gain them immediatly but they fall on the floor and it takes like 2 seconds to collect them if you dont put your mouse on them, while clicking its annoying to collect the teeth at the same time, I think you should add an option in the option box 'Collect teeth instantly' and you can mark V, getting currency in idle games is the main thing, and when its taking a long time (2 seconds is pretty long) its not fun. TL;DR: this game is cool with a really nice concept, and I think you should change the currency collection.  Good luck in the future :)  hope your game will keep rocking.

Clicker Heroes: Halloween Edition  The art is excellent... other than that, it is a generic clicker game. I'm staying for the aesthetic though and am awaiting gameplay updates.  Edit: The art may be stolen... wow. A lot of it seems to be stolen images that were photoshopped over.  Getting to the first ascension takes an absurd amount of time.  Clicker Heroes is better.  Edit: Just came across the mannequin spider from Silent Hill: Revelations. Well, they already have Pyramid Head around. Plenty of stolen concepts. Lot of art has absolutely been traced over originals.  Enemy animation is really lazy... they swing back'n'forth with a tiny bit of zoom. Then motion blur occurs as if they're attacking you - which doesn't make sense since you don't have an HP bar of your own.  I want to ascend already...  Edit: Mother of God. The game is currently frozen because I slammed all my abilities on and clicked to the high heavens. Critical hits make the entire game shake - its like a Banjo Kazooie dance along with all the damn boxes going ooga-booga. I thought I turned effects like that off, but no - them devs ain't right. Oh, and because the game likes to do that bull 'Are you sure you want to exit?', you can't just close it if its frozen. You have to pull out Task Manager.  Unity please...

with the last update the game progress becomes so much harder that it will be near impossible to catch up to older players without buying gems.  Basiscly your sin production will be handicapped from the start.
This 'game' is basically just a copy of Clicker Heroes with updated art style. Costs and skills are directly ripped off from Clicker Heroes. I don't mind a bit of inspiration but this is just shoddy.

pros: -good looking -simle to learn ofc ;D -descent gore teeth instead of coins gives an extra effect  cons: -cluttered -slugish -feels like a straight rip off with reskin from clicker hereos  I would recommend to those who: Love gore and doesnt mind the clutter when clicking from the blood stains.  conclusion: It is a fun simple game if you like gory clicker, however i'm not able to recommend it because it feels a bit to cluttered for my liking when it comes to clickers, just a tiny bit to much detail in the menu art style for the monsters are AMAZING, if you want a better game in my eyes i would recommend clicker heroes instead where it have come alot further in development, there is clans you can join you can ascend for a faster run later on and later on transend which can speed it up even more.  NOW i haven't played alot of it and i dont know if there is clans and ascension like things, as i've seen the menus doesnt show anywhere where those tabs for clan and such could appear.  To make this game better: You could make a few less details in the menu and such would be good in my eyes. If there is clans make room so you can see there is clans to. add more gore such as bodies being cut in half and falling over whent they are killed just for extra gore if thats what you are aiming for in this game.  last but not least i must say good luck to the developers to make this game better and add more feutures!

Insanity Clicker is horror themed idle clicker game. The games description on the store page describes it as a “terrifying survival simulator” when in reality its just a clone of clicker heroes with a horror themed UI. The game is nothing special and there is not a lot to talk about except for that unlike in other idle games, there is no real enthusiasm/joy/entertainment about progressing in this game. After you take out the first 50 or so monsters and the first boss your “pets”, as they are called in the game, will be strong enough to apply a decent amount of damage to the monsters without any need for your input. You dont feel like you clicking provides much of a benefit from then on out and this is especially true for the later levels where you pets will hammer out 500 million damage per second where your clicking may only result in 50 thousand damage per click.  I was a big fan of the original Cookie Clicker game and other idle games such as Bit Coin Billionaire, but with his game i just felt bored playing it. You can just run it in background and farm while you do other things and still progress in the game. In fact you dont even have to have this game running in the background as it has a very high currency limit when the game isnt running. I stopped played this at about 1:30 in the morning and when i woke up at 10 the following day and started the game i got a huge 66 million currency bonus which gives you a huge advantage over the game which make it too easy to progress.   Pros/Things I liked:  - The monster sprites looked cool  - The ambition of the game’s description on steam  Cons/Things i didn’t like:  - Everything else in the game   Score Card  Rating: 2/10  Recommended for: People who like to watch paint dry but dont have the money to buy paint

Nice artwork. Jumpy graphics try to simulate jumpscares. Mostly annoying sound, inconsistent effects, (female screams coming from dead masculine monsters). The game didn't seem to try to explain itself at all. I ended up letting it fight on auto and messaged friends instead.   I rate this one click/10. Would delete again.

At the moment this game has potential if only for the sheer volume of art assets clearly already put into the game. As far as an idle clicker goes it's not bad, but there are a few huge flaws at the moment that bother me.  First of all, the default font. While the super grungy, edgy font choice looks fine in larger titles and buttons, on smaller resolutions (such as in a window) it becomes illegible. I felt like I spent far too long trying to decipher monster names, minion abilities, etc before finally just giving up since it wasn't worth the effort.  Secondly, while I realize this is quite a new game (and an idle clicker at that), it would be helpful to have a FAQ built into the game. Some features (such as the character screen, equipment, and illnesses) are pretty esoteric without context.  Overall it's a decent achievement farming game, but those few nitpicks detract from what would be an otherwise pretty standard clicker experience.
